static Complex [] edu.ou.asgbook.transforms.FFT.fft ( Complex[]  x  )  [static]

Computes FFT of array whose length is a power of 2. 

00054                                              {
00055         int N = x.length;
00056 
00057         if (N == 1){
00058             return new Complex[] { x[0] };
00059         } else if (N % 2 != 0) {
00060             throw new IllegalArgumentException("N is not a power of 2");
00061         }
00062 
00063         // Break the array down into two parts and perform FFT of each piece
00064         Complex[] part = new Complex[N / 2];
00065         for (int k = 0; k < N / 2; k++) {
00066             part[k] = x[2 * k]; // even terms
00067         }
00068         Complex[] evenfft = fft(part);
00069         for (int k = 0; k < N / 2; k++) {
00070             part[k] = x[2 * k + 1]; // odd terms
00071         }
00072         Complex[] oddfft = fft(part);
00073 
00074         // combine
00075         Complex[] y = new Complex[N];
00076         for (int k = 0; k < N / 2; k++) {
00077             double kth = -2 * k * Math.PI / N;
00078             Complex wk = new Complex(Math.cos(kth), Math.sin(kth));
00079             y[k] = evenfft[k].add(wk.multiply(oddfft[k]));
00080             y[k + N / 2] = evenfft[k].subtract(wk.multiply(oddfft[k]));
00081         }
00082         return y;
00083     }

static Complex [] edu.ou.asgbook.transforms.FFT.ifft ( Complex[]  x  )  [static]

compute inverse FFT of array whose length is a power of 2 

00086                                               {
00087         int N = x.length;
00088 
00089         // Conjugate x
00090         Complex[] y = new Complex[N];
00091         for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
00092             y[i] = x[i].conjugate();
00093         }
00094 
00095         // compute forward FFT
00096         y = fft(y);
00097 
00098         // Conjugate result and divide by N
00099         for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
00100             y[i] = y[i].conjugate().divide(N);
00101         }
00102 
00103         return y;
00104 
00105     }

00108         DecimalFormat df = new DecimalFormat("0.0");
00109         // FFT( rect ) should be a sinc function
00110         FFT.Complex[] input = new FFT.Complex[32];
00111         for (int i=0; i < input.length; ++i){
00112             input[i] = new FFT.Complex(0,0);
00113         }
00114         for (int i=input.length/3; i < 2*input.length/3; ++i){
00115             input[i] = new FFT.Complex(1, 0);
00116         }
00117         FFT.Complex[] output = fft(input);
00118         for (int i=0; i < output.length; ++i){
00119             System.out.print(df.format(output[i].norm()) + " ");
00120         }
00121         System.out.println();
00122         FFT.Complex[] reverse = ifft(output);
00123         for (int i=0; i < reverse.length; ++i){
00124             System.out.print(df.format(reverse[i].norm()) + " ");
00125         }
00126         System.out.println();
00127     }
